p: T. serrulatus is an endemic medicinal plant traditionally used for various disease conditions including flue ( Meresa et al., 2017) and cough ( Melka et al., 2016). In various scientific studies the plant has been found active against various bacterial and fungal strains ( Damtie and Mokonen, 2016), possess diuretic and antihyperlipidemic ( Melka et al., 2016; Getachew, 2018). Also, the smooth muscle relaxant effect (vasodilatory) of the plant was observed in an ex vivo study by ( Geleta et al., 2015).
